column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. Motorcycles:
column4: must share a traffic lane with another vehicle.
column6: are easier to see than cars.
column8: are entitled to use a complete traffic lane.

column2: 2. Drivers should not sound their horn when:
column4: they may hit another vehicle.

column2: 3. When passing a vehicle,  it is safe to return to your lane when:
column4: the driver you just passed signals you over.
column6: you look over your shoulder and see no vehicle behind you.
column8: you can see both headlights of the vehicle you passed in your rearview mirror.

column2: 4. Construction zone signs are generally:
column4: diamond or rectangular with orange and black coloring.
column6: triangular with black and yellow coloring.

column2: 5. A yellow arrow on a traffic signal means:
column4: Be prepared to stop and give the right-of-way to oncoming vehicles.
column6: Drivers are not required to signal before turning from that lane.
column8: Increase your speed to make the turn before the light changes.

column2: 6. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.
column8: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.

column2: 7. Collisions can happen more often when:
column4: all vehicles are traveling at the posted speed limit.
column6: one vehicle is traveling faster than the flow of traffic.
column8: one lane of traffic is traveling faster than the others.

column2: 8. Drivers who have been drinking are more likely to:
column4: keep a safe following distance.

column2: 9. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: approach the turn in the right lane or from the right side of a single lane.
column6: approach the turn in the left lane or from the left side of a single lane.
column8: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.

column2: 10. This yellow sign means:
column4: Lane ends ahead

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column4: There is a series of sharp turns up ahead on the road
column6: A road joins from the right

column2: 12. As you enter a roundabout you should slow down and:
column4: yield to pedestrians and bicyclist crossing before entering the roundabout.
column6: yield to any vehicle coming from your left in the roundabout.

column2: 13. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column4: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.
column6: To keep a smooth traffic flow.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column4: Four-lane traffic ahead

column2: 15. A good rule of thumb for drivers sharing the road with a truck is:
column4: always try to stay alongside a truck, but never drive right behind it.
column6: if you can’t see the truck driver in their side mirror, they can’t see you.
column8: it is better to drive to the immediate right of the cab.

column2: 16. If a vehicle is coming towards you at night with its high beams on, making it hard to see the road ahead, you should:
column4: look straight ahead towards the middle of the lane.
column6: look ahead towards the left edge of your lane.
column8: look ahead towards the right edge of your lane.

column2: 17. When turning, drivers should:
column4: increase their speed to improve stability.
column8: always move to the right lane.

column2: 18. If your steering wheel were a clock, your hands should be at the ______ positions.
column4: 12 o'clock and 9 o'clock

column2: 19. This is the shape and color of a ________ sign.
column4: do not enter

column2: 20. The first thing affected after drinking alcohol is:
column4: judgment.

column2: 21. When being passed by another vehicle, drivers should:
column4: slow down.

column2: 22. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
column4: accelerate much faster

column2: 23. This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
column4: maximum speed

column2: 24. The picture shows:
column4: a reversible road sign.

column2: 25. To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
column4: look well down the road and far off to each side.
column6: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.
